Reviews.Title: “I stayed here during my trip to London”
Reviews.Author: RajaRathor
Reviews.Content: This place was around 10 miles from the office that we were supposed to visit each day for a week and the experience we had here was a very pleasant one. The brunch in the morning was very rich and the cleanliness was next to best I had seen in my life. The rooms were small and compact but had a nice arrangement and the people were also very cordial. We had a very nice stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: leotb
Reviews.Content: Great service by staff, including over the phone before check in. Parking first come first served, but free. Great location for Alexandra Palace. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JLloyd4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raglan for 1 night on Sat Feb 11th, and can honestly say this is the best hotel we have ever stayed at!! Booking: Booked online, hotel sent clear directions on request on how to reach them by tube Arrival: Randy on reception gave a glowing first impression of the hotel- friendly, welcoming and no nonsense! He explained there were no double rooms left and upgraded us to a luxury double. Room: The room was lovely, clean and warm (Randy had told us about a boiler problem earlier that day, and went out of his way to ensure our radiators were working). The shower was superb. We believe the room was an adjoining room as we could hear our neighbours quite clearly!! The breakfast was fine, but it was the lovely staff who gave a lasting impression about the quality of the hotel. Right round the corner from the Ally Pally, (a chilly walk in the snow!) so brilliant location. If we're back in London, you'll be our first choice. (next time we'd like a cookie on the way out, we feel most left out after reading your other reviews!!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: beasy1204
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at this hotel because it was in a great location for seeing an event at the Alexandre Palace. The single room at The Raglan compares favorably with other single rooms I've stayed in England. The size of the room for a solo traveler is fine and the furnishings are all modern and in good order. One thing that really impressed me was the free Wi-Fi that they offered. I can't count the numbers of 4 and 5 star hotels that I've been to that either had no in room wi-fi, or if they did, it was offered at an outrageous price. When I compare my experience staying here to some of the earlier reviews that were posted for this hotel, I can tell that their management has worked hard to address issues brought up in these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “It does a job!”
Reviews.Author: jjamfactory
Reviews.Content: The Raglan is ok, but lacks being special. The welcome was warm & friendly but once past the facade of the spacious and nicely designed reception, it all seemed a bit tired. A narrow staircase led to a cold bedroom with a view over airconditioning ducts. The room had a fabulous big bed (well two singles pushed together), the bathroom was small but clean (tiny towels though, with a faint whiff of vinegar!), and the loo needed a degree of brute force to flush successfully. Breakfast was adequate (rather scruffy laminated menus were a bit grim). I was so pleased we booked with breakfast included because £10 a head for a 'full English' for room only guests was steep for the quality on offer. The staff were all great - nice touch offering a biscuit and a bottle of water on departure.

Reviews.Title: “Reet Petite!”
Reviews.Author: faith_in_U
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had stayed at the Roseview last year and thought we'd give The Raglan a try this time. From the outside the Raglan looks a bit more up-market than the Roseview further down the road and yet behind the ostentacious facade the 2 hotels are very similar. THE COST We booked the Raglan through Hotels.com and got a 10% discount on the room rate. For 2 nights we paid £135.00 instead of £150.00. We had to pay £8.95 each for full English breakfast (£35.80 for 4). Altogether the cost for the room for 2 nights and 4 breakfasts came to £170.80. THE ROOM We were given room 221 which was located on the second floor. Those with mobility problems need to be aware that there is no lift and many stairs. The stair carpet had seen better days in some areas, as did the overall decor on the stairs and landings. The room itself was tiny, and the walls were paper thin, you could hear people in the room above. It was well decorated, but not much room to move in. The dressing table was small and cluttered with all manner of things so it left little space for your own stuff. The bed was comfy but only a double (we are used to a kingsize), and the duvet had seen better days, it was thin.The bed linen was spotlessly clean, and there were 4 plump pillows. Towels in the spotlessly clean shower room were fluffy and white. Complimentary toiletries were also supplied. THE BREAKFAST Breakfast was good. Fresh juices, cereals, toast, lots of fresh coffee, tea etc, and the cooked Full English was good. It really did set us up for the day. Breakfast we would give full marks. One nice touch was when we were leaving we were given a couple of cookies and bottles of water for our journey home. Overall The Raglan is a decent hotel to stay at, it is clean with pleasant and courteous staff, and the breakfast is good. Whether it justifies its cost over that of the Roseview, as well as its rating of a 3 star 'boutique' hotel is questionable. The choice dear reader is yours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for the Ally Pally”
Reviews.Author: davestoz
Reviews.Content: Went to the darts at ally pally only a 15 min walk from this hotel so ideal location. Some of the players and commentators stay here to met Bristow at breakfast be aware though no lift and loads of stairs so not really for the not very mobile staff very helpful good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: axlrocky
Reviews.Content: This is a typical London hotel in as much as your not going to get absolute luxury like in foreign climes but the Raglan is not a bad stay. The rooms are small but well appointed and the TV, internet access and bed were all of an acceptable standard. There is a lot of stairs which is a pain but then that is to be expected in hotels that are in converted houses. the main thing that made the stay good was the service, we were going to an event at Ally Pally (short walk 5 mins) and wanted to get into Camden cheaply in the day, the reception provided maps, accurate directions and local transport timetables. Very impressive. I didnt take the breakfast option which I thought to be a little pricey (10.95 or 8.95 booked in advance) but smells coming from the kitchen seemed nice. There were plenty of local cafes and restaurants within a stones throw of the raglan. I wouldnt think it suitable for long stays in London but for a short weekend break where you are not expecting to be in the hotel much it is a reasonably priced solution.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Rooms, Shame No Lift”
Reviews.Author: phastings
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at the Raglan, but the staff were welcoming and helpful. My room was on the 3rd floor, and there was no lift. At least reception warned me and apologised in advance. Luckily I didn't have a heavy bag, but I could imagine this could have stressed some people out. The climb was well worth it though as the room was gorgeous. Plenty of room, facilities and a nice modern bathroom. I was leaving early the next morning, so didn't get to sample the dining facilities, but on checkout I was given a bottle of water and a cookie. Nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Refusal to refund Laterooms booking”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked a two night stay with the Raglan through LateRooms (£85/night, 7th and 8th October) because he was exhibiting at Ally Pally 8th and 9th Oct. At the last minute (Thursday 6th Oct) the stand at the exhibition was cancelled; he immediately used the Laterooms site to cancell the booking. The cancellation was made approx 1.5hours after the 2pm cut-off time for cancellation, and £85 was charged to his credit card. I subsequently spoke to the Laterooms rep who in turn spoke to the Bookings clerk at the hotel and (to cut a long story shprt) we were refused a refund. My Husband also e-mailed the bookings clear himself, however the refund was still not forthcoming. I feel that the Hotel had ample time to rebook the room and £85 is a lot of money to a sole trader, which he can ill afford to loose. We are unlikely (as a couple, my company or my husband's company) ever to book this Hotel again, due to their intransigence. Should the general manager wish to reply to the above (and arrange a refund), please use helenm@kodit.com.

Reviews.Title: “Too cold!!”
Reviews.Author: BambiMoore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Raglan for one night after a wedding. First impressions were that I could not believe they charge £129 for such a small room. The room was also freezing cold although both radiators were on! The bed was uncomfortable and the duvet was so thin it was basically a sheet which didn't help the freezing conditions! The radiators did not come on in the morning either, we went to have breakfast which was ok then went back to the room to have showers before we checked out. The room was so cold I phoned through to reception, they explained the radiators are on a timer and they only come on when it goes below a certain temperature. I'm sorry but if your paying £120 for a room you should have a temperature control in your room and be able to do it yourself! All in all it was a very cold experience at the Raglan and I'm in no hurry to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, some nice touches”
Reviews.Author: sheenamary
Reviews.Content: We were exhibiting at Ally Pally and this was convenient for leaving the car parked on the forecourt (limited spaces, you have to grab your chance at about 9.00am when the last lot of guests leave after breakfast) and stroll down Dukes Avenue to the bottom of the hill where there's a pedestrian entrance to the Palace grounds. The Standard Double room was small but comfortable and reasonably equipped and we had no problem with noise. We were on the second floor so had a climb up narrow staircases to get there but had great views over the neighbourhood from a large window. The breakfast was very good – nice bacon and sausages, and fresh fruit to start. The staff were friendly and helpful and we were given a small bottle of water and a cookie "for the journey" when we left, which was a thoughtful touch. Less positive points: the carpets need renewing, especially on the stairs and corridors. The corridors and stairs are narrow so negotiating them with big bags is tricky. The shower in our room was very stiff to turn on and off, so much so we called reception the first morning because we couldn't turn it on at all, but they came within 2 minutes to sort us out. The room rate isn't cheap – we paid £95 for Thursday night and £89 for Friday – but you expect that with London fringes and it was worth the extra over a budget chain on the North Circular to be within walking distance of lots of shops and restaurants and the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: bethije
Reviews.Content: Arriving after a long drive to find parking was a few inaccessible spaces in front of the hotel was frustrating but on entering the hotel things improved considerably. The staff were warm, helpful and very accommodating. I had a single room, which as expected was small but beautiful appointed and very comfortable. I couldn't ask for better. The bar was great although I would recommend you go elsewhere for food unless you actually want a reheated frozen meal ( as I was informed by the staff when he brought me my noodles and apologized for the presentation!) I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: SJC_NZ
Reviews.Content: We paid £98 for one night and chose this due to its proximity to Alexandra Palace (a short walk). First impression were excellent, very friendly staff on front desk. But then we ended up having a really bad experience so will never be back. Our stay ended up in an argument with manager, will detail this below. I'll list the good points first - friendly welcome, clean rooms, comfy bed. Then the bad - - Despite booking nearly 2 months in advance, we were given a small, dark, ground floor room facing a wall. Thought early bookings tended to get first pick of good rooms? - Thin walls, could hear conversations and bathroom noises from neighbour. - Fan in bathroom kept making loud noise for an hour after turning off so kept us awake. And then the worst thing was that we missed out on breakfast due to miscommunication, and were treated VERY rudely by staff. It's pretty simple, you sign in at reception, pay for breakfast in advance, and the form gives accurate breakfast times. I just glanced at it, so later when we got back to hotel from concert I asked the girl when breakfast ended. She said 10.30am. Then in the morning I double checked the info folder in the room, it also said 10.30am. So at 10:15am we went to dining room and were told it was over at 10am. Queried this at reception, and they confirmed it was 10am. I said I'd been told different and wasn't impressed. All they needed to do was say "sorry about the confusion, we'll refund the money for breakfast now." Instead, they got annoyed at me, pointed out extremely patronisingly that I had signed the form with the time of 10am stated on it. I said that wasn't really the point at all, could I get my money back? She didn't want to do it!!! I asked for the manager, he started repetitively lecturing me also. I said I was sick of hearing the same thing repeated, and that was no way to talk to a guest. "Just refund the money please so we can leave...". He just had to point out one more time that it said 10am on the form I signed. I was FURIOUS by this stage. What is it with customer service people who want to have the last word?? In conclusion, I did get my refund. Then went back to my room, grabbed the folder of hotel info that CLEARLY stated 10.30am and took it back to them as we exited. Did he apologise then for his rudeness. NO. Totally shocking experience over something so petty. Suggest reviewing all hotel info given to guests, and send all staff and management on a customer services course!!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelling_elisa
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel for my parents and I came to the hotel in person long before their arrival, in order to choose the room personally. The staff was friendly. However at my parent's arrival they gave us a different room, far smaller and darker and with a view on the conditioning machine which blew hot air if you opened the window. Considered that there is no breakfast included and that we had a room quite different from our expectations (and from pictures on the website) it can be considered quite overpriced. Then I decided to book other hotels nearby for my parents' next visits.

Reviews.Title: “Randy saved the day!!”
Reviews.Author: howsam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Raglan 29th & 30th of June 2011, we had booked a double room at bed & breakfast rate £200.00 for 2 nights. Upon arrival we were informed that the hotels hot water system had broken down & they were waiting for a part so it could be fixed. We were allocated room 115, not great, very small double, crap view, not a great start...... So we dropped off our bags and off we went to explore London. Later that evening we decided to ask if we could change rooms, we are NOT people who ever complain, but just thought it might be worth a try, Randy the guy at reception was MORE than helpful, he apologised about the water & was willing to offer us a different room. New room was 301 and it was BRILL, very spacious double, FAB view, nice bathroom we couldnt have asked for more, OK, well hot water would have been nice but that was beyond their control, these things happen & it was back on the next morning!! Hooray!! A discount of £20 was given for not having hot water on the first night. Breakfast was nice, plenty to eat, nice choice of cereals, yoghurt, toast, full english even kippers if you so wished. Massive Thank-you to Randy, best receptionist ever, made our 2 night stay one to remember! All the staff were friendly & helpful, even the morning we left the chap on reception gave us photo-copy of map and directions to avoid road works on way home. Would stay again but would make sure we booked either room 301 or similar room.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jack2502
Reviews.Content: The reception has been furnished to a high standard but my room was a little less impressive. My single room was boxroom size. Adequate if you are looking only for a place to sleep and shower. Good proximity to Muswell Hill and on into central London. Staff courteous. At £74 pn it was fine but it wouldn't justify the rates published at reception.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely stay here last year and we've booked again for this year!”
Reviews.Author: KristyJane
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I go to the Alexandra palace every December. Last year we were a little worried after reading some of these reviews..... That said, these were all completely dispelled after we stayed! Hence our re-booking for this coming December! I should have writted a nice report last year but never got round to it so here it is...Take no notice of the bad stuff. This is a super hotel, its clean and upbeat with really friendly helpful staff. We had absolutely no complaints and its very reasonably priced. Its right in the middle of Muswell Hill and only a 15 minute walk to the Ally Pally. We are all middle aged (sad to say) and have stayed in many hotels - This is a really nice one, honest!

Reviews.Title: “Grotty and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: 7Danni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after a friends wedding and were very disapointed. It was £130 for a nights stay and in return we had dirty sheets a broken kettle and a room the size of a large bathroom. Breakfast was not included either. Not deserving of the lovely area that it is in. A B & B would have been far better.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced very very noisey traffic non stop through night nd day”
Reviews.Author: naomigriff
Reviews.Content: Stated here as had an operation in the highgate hospital, taxi only cost £6 to get there and taxi to paddington station cost £18. Stayed here on a boiling weekend, rooms were like a sauna no joke. Had to open the windowsill but the traffic noise is Non stop couldn't wait to leave after 2nights as the traffic noise was mental. At night couldn't hear tv due to us having to have windows open. rooms at first glance look lovely but when I picked the book from desk it was covered in dust, hand prints and dust over furniture. Randy at reception was lovely, and beds were comfy. Id stay here again for the hospital but not during warm weather again it felt worse than being on hols, at least on hols u have fans, and air con.

Reviews.Title: “Good- Nice change”
Reviews.Author: JaneGNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip. A pleasant change from premier Inn/ Days Inn/ Holiday Inn type accomodation but within that price range. Bed and room were comfortable and spoltlessly clean. Great shower. Nice breakfast in airy room. There was a bar serving snacks and drinks- which is important as a woman travelling alone. Not all hotels have this facility. It is a bit spread out with lots of corodoors- but the staff offered to take my case up. In fact the staff were really helpfu with info, directions to my meeting etc. I was a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews but for a decently priced overnight stay - it's great

Reviews.Title: “23 February 2011 - Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: stepnju
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raglan for 2 nights. Before our visit we had read the other reviews and wondered what we would find. The reception area was attractive. 24 hour reception. Our room was well furnished and bed linen attractive. The room had clearly been recently refurbished and had double glazing. We were aware that renovation work was being undertaken but this was unobtrusive. Breakfast was a simple continental one but perfectly adequate. There was an option to purchase a cooked breakfast. It was vey easy to get into central London. Bus stop only a couple of hundred metres and buses regular.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: landyman2
Reviews.Content: On first impression the hoel foyer was clean and welcoming. However once we were in the bedroom a totaly differnet picture presented itself. The room was tired and shabby. The bed was two beds pushed together which looked awfully huge but was surprisngly comfortable. The view from our room was of a huge ventiator duct about four feet from the window. Sleep on the first night was hampered by the disco, for a wedding party, below our room, but to be fair it did end at 11.45pm. On the second night a guest next door left his T.V. on all night, as a consequence I left feeling more tired than when I arrived. On the plus side, staff were kind and helpful, the breakfast was good and the restraunt area clean. There was only one hiccough when the waiter was addamant that we were room only and we knew that we were bed and breakfast. Once the booking form was checked, he wasted no time to say sorry. We do understand that he was diong his job. Over all, not the best that money can buy. If you are driving down, be aware that you may have fun tyring to find a place to park.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby and dismal although the staff were helpful”
Reviews.Author: Hilwill
Reviews.Content: Having read the last review it was with some trepidation we checked in. As we were guests at a function there it had made sense to stay. . . Whilst the room was warm (in fact perhaps too warm although I am not complaining) the shower was ICY, the water must come straight from the mains. I managed to wash my hair in the basin but could not find a hairdryer, rang down and one was there within 3 minutes which was good - in fact the staff were the best thing about the hotel. Regarding the dust and filthy bathroom (very much in need of a serious clean and a re-furb) the problem appears to be the lighting. Well, the lack of it. The two bulbs in our room gave off a total of about 20 watts I think, not enough to read by anyway so the dust probably goes unoticed. There was a flat roof outside the window covered in cigarette ends, lovely. The breakfast plate was warm and on the second morning so was the food, I opted for the museli then changed my mind as I think it was sawdust. The tea was an interesting shade of grey. Even the food at the function was pretty grim although they did manage to find a slice of lime for my drink. Soundproofing is non existant - I did not want to listen to the Superbowl, sadly the man in the next room did. They are doing some work to the hotel it appears, however, they really need to raise their game if they want to stay in business I feel - not a place for us again anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby not a true representation of the rest of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NohoIhoRa
Reviews.Content: Pros: Downstairs lobby very impressive. Bed comfortable. Bathroom and bed linen very clean. Decent hair dryer. Con's: Endless stairs up to bedrooms and no lifts so tough if you have luggage. Inadaquate blind on the window making it impossible to shut out the street light. Carpet in the bedroom grubby with bits from previous occupant. Pillows so hard I had a sore neck in the morning. Radiator in the room didn't work and the receptionist said 'but the weather is mild'.............January?? and I had preparation work to complete for the next day. She suggested an extra blanket or a duvet.and it was only when I insisted that actually I wanted a warm room that she agreed to send up someone to look at the radiator. Otherwise I would have to wait until the following day...I was checking out then. 3 hangers in the wardrobe...Lucky there was just myself. Hairs on the telephone that were not mine. Room dark and gloomy. I had asked for a quiet room but was given a room facing out on the main road and told 'but it doesn't get noisy and the double glazing works really well'. No, it doesn't actually. Parking a nightmare. I would have given this hotel a higher rating but the attitude of the receptionist on the night of the 17th was so unhelpful and dismissive that I feel I can't in any honesty rate it any higher than I have.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Alexandra Palace”
Reviews.Author: JSandA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December for the darts at Alexandra Palace, mainly because it's the closest hotel to the venue. But it is a good hotel, this was our second time staying and will book again in the future

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather stay on the streets”
Reviews.Author: Stephania094
Reviews.Content: First i arrived and wasn't too impressed anyway, as the pictures are very decieving. I had a family room, which was a little better, but all my friends had double rooms and could barely move the room was that small. Also the hotel is very confusing, too many staircases etc. The heating was on full blast in the hotel and was very claustrophobic, as the halls were very narrow anyway. Anyway so we went out, came back and unfortunatley someone forgot the key in the room, but obviousley didnt think this would be a problem, as there would be spare in the reception and could get the key back. Well, we thought wrong. There was no spare copy, there was also no master key. The manager said we had to wait till 9am in the morning for the housekeeper to come to open the room. We were then given another room to stay in, with none of our belongings as everything was in the room. 9am came, and the housekeeper didnt even have a key, instead the lock had to be changed, as it was changed, all the mess was still left all around our door etc. On check out, the service on reception was disgusting, and didnt understand our issue, and said it wasnt her fault, but infact mine. I refused to pay, but then in the end as i was arguing for endless amount of time, i agreed to £15 off, but im still not happy at all, and would very much rather sleep in the car then go back there.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star well not quite!”
Reviews.Author: thebarnB&B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from what should have been a memorable weekend, well it is but for the wrong reasons. Hotel reccommended by friends as a good place to stay whilst in North London for their wedding reception. Grotty doesn't do it justice. 3 star? have stayed in far better 3 star hotels, this is a miserable example.Part of the Belsize Park Group according to the reseipt.Located in Queens Avenue. Only 5 parking spaces, we were lucky as my husband is disabled we bagged the only disabled bay there! Reception staff friendly and efficient, room very small, bed even smaller 4 foot wide for 2 people,on one side you could just squeeze down the side to get in. narrow corridoors and stairs ( we wondered about fire regs), no lift of help with luggage, no hot water to the shower, had to ask for milk as there wasn't any and only 2 tea bags! Lots of extras,the shower gel and shampoo had been used previously and had dribbles down the tubes! nice!breakfast sad and served on icy cold plates. Would we stay there again? wild horses wouldn't drag me there! Over priced for a 3 star. One to avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Was afraid of reviews but needn't have worried!”
Reviews.Author: Exiled_Angel
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about the reviews here as I booked for 3 nights for my 30th bday but needn't have worried. I knew there was a wedding party the same weekend and asked for a room away from the noise - we were never bothered. The room was nice and clean, a little small maybe especially the shower room but sufficient for our needs, and a little cool at night (if there was a temperature modulator we never found it but weren't bothered that much). The hotel itself is well linked by public buses, we never waited more than a few mins and the local area is charming. Friendly receptionists and breakfast staff. I was enormously relieved and was happy with the choice. No one else seemed to have any complaints either! I would definitely stay here again. Thanks to the Raglan!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...EVER!”
Reviews.Author: lesliepaul37
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for business. I arrived at 2130hrs to be greeted by a very smiley but extremely useless receptionist. Having had a long journey I asked what time the restaurant closed and was informed that the hotel didn't have one. Upon opening the door to my room a nauseating smell of faeces hit me (I’ve worked in hospitals and care homes for over 30 years and know the smell). I checked the bathroom but this smelt wonderful...it was coming from the carpets. The loo seat fell off at the first touch, the hand basin immediately overflowed when I tried to wash my hands and the nice looking 4-poster bed was as hard as a rock. I chose not to have a bath or shower as I have had typhoid before and didn’t want a repeat. The hotel is very noisy, not in a good location i.e. 20 walk from the nearest tube station and the food is fair to bad. If you value yourself don’t stay here. I work for a large national organisation and we have taken this off of our satisfactory list of hotel so I will never be going back there and neither will any of my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: whickhammob
Reviews.Content: I was booked in at short notice. Parking in London is hopeless so I took the train. The front desk staff were VERY helpful with getting me on and off tubes and buses to my various appointments. My room was clean and comfortable with a nice full sized bathroom, tea and coffee and a hair dryer-plenty of towels and room service was fine too. Really friendly helpful staff who made me sandwiches when I came in late one night. The breakfast was plentiful-toast ,yoghurt , fruit , Danish pastries,or a cooked breakfast to order- I believe there were kippers too. Lashings of tea and coffee. I really don"t know what on earth everyone is complaining about. Muswell Hill is also a nice residential area and is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room, poor parking”
Reviews.Author: foodieHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Raglan when attending my nieces wedding. Our room was awful. Tiny, with just a few inches either side of the bed and nowhere to our our bags except the floor where we tripped over them. The room was not clen - thick dust on top of the tv, and one of the tea mugs had a big chip in it. My sister paid exactly the same for her room and it was lovely - spacious and clean. Why the difference, we paid the same rate? At the wedding dinner, my partner was given his main course, and the rest of our table got theirs 10 minutes later! We told him to start, the staff then realised they had made a mistake and tried to take his plate away half eaten! Instead of giving the rest of us our food, they made us wait as it wasn't our turn! Parking is awful - pot luck if you can get a space in the road so be prepared to drive around looking for one. Breakfast was nice, but not worth the extra (£10 for full english) unless you can get a B&B deal. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: michleec
Reviews.Content: Our friend who lives near the Raglan booked this hotel for us when our booking for another hotel fell through at the last minute. this place was truly horrible and the staff acted dishonestly--playing a bait and switch with the rooms. That is,the room we were put in was not the room our friend was shown. We stayed two nights (and then thank goodness left for a different hotel) Each night we asked for a different room but was told the hotel was fully booked--didn't seem that way. Our room was on the ground floor--the carpet in the hallways and in the room was stained. The doors were chipped with the paint peeling off. Our room was not much bigger than a closet. there was nowhere to put our suitcases so we had to leave them on the floor which meant stepping over them when we moved around the room. the bed was small. The window looked out onto a brick wall. There was a large stain on the wall. There was no air conditioning (not even a fan) and the room was horribly hot and stuffy. The room was so claustrophobic it actually made us ill. This place was so nasty we actually felt like we were in a residential hotel in the Tenderloin of San Francisco. The walls were also very thin and our second night was disrupted by an amorous couple in the next room. Breakfast was not included in the price so we ate around the corner at the Giraffe and got a great breakfast for half the price the hotel charges. this hotel is also located in North London so it took us a half hour to get to Central London on the Underground. Stay away from this place. The rooms pictured in the hotel advertising are nothing like what we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned. Don't book with another website”
Reviews.Author: AllanNorwich
Reviews.Content: We booked with another website to get a cheaper deal. It turns out they can only book the few inferior rooms. Don't be tempted! There were no proper drawers. There was a gap of less than 2 feet either side of a small double bed. There was very little space at the end of the bed and just a narrow coridor to the door. The hotel looks OK from outside but it hides a sequence of dingy narrow corridors hiding a mish mash of rooms. The service was OK. The breakfast was OK apart from when we went down early to be greeted with leathery bacon mashed beans and a cold selection from food that had stood for ages.

Reviews.Title: “[--]”
Reviews.Author: fredHampshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a scam advertising as something they realy are not !!!!!! we stayed here a week ago and thats we arrived at :THE RAGLAN: as we came in the hotel didnt have eny praking !! so we whent to the reception and spoke to a lady EVA. the problem got even worse !! she woz just simply sed uselessseeee !! enyway the reception filthy .... we found a parking space aboute 5 miles away ... then the reale nighmere came we then whent to the staires crakly noisy ... the room very small (tiny) the shower broken anly 5 chanels all not in tune dirty room .next the restorant woz ok but the menu didnt have enything that they wher offering so only expensive boos ?? i dont need to say more as i hope this will help people i there desition to stay in THE RAGLAN.........

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 40slady-10
Reviews.Content: Having booked a weekend stay before reading the reviews, we arrived with some trepidation and were immediately reassured by our friendly welcome and the general ambience of the hotel. Our twin room was small (as we had expected), but how much space does one really need in a hotel? It was spotlessly clean - as were all the rooms we used - and all the usual facilities were provided, such as tea, coffee, biscuits, tissues etc. The beds were comfortable, and the lighting was better than in many larger hotels we have used. The location could not have been more convenient, as we were far enough out of the city to be able to breathe fresh air, and the journey into central London was really easy - a short bus ride to the tube, and then access to all areas. Just around the corner from the hotel were shops of all kinds, and the restaurants were varied and served great food. The only slight drawback was some traffic noise during the night, but, as a light sleeper, I always use earplugs and would deem them essential for other light sleepers. The breakfast was brilliant! Neither of us could manage a lunch after one of those. All in all, an experience we will be repeating when next in London

Reviews.Title: “Looked good on the website”
Reviews.Author: LincolnLiz
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, on top floor, no lift, but offer of help with bags. Daughter found this hotel, as it was nearby where she and her partner live in Crouch End, in a one bedroom flat.so seemed perfect for us to stay when visiting. Oh dear,male wedding guests staying in next rooms, on both sides decided to party at 4.30 am, they were very drunk, and very noisy, lots of swearing, pretty disgusting language, Smoking in a no smoking room, the smell coming through the open windows lots of clanking beer cans. doors banging as they went from room to room. After half an hour I telephoned reception from my mobile, as there was no phone in the room, to be told that they were paying guests so there was not a lot they could do or say apart from asking them to lower the noise! Which they did not do anyway, I called reception again twice, from my mobile, they did not even reply. At 6am the noise stopped, so then managed a couple of hours sleep.we were paying guests too.what a dreadful night. That morning we bumped into a mum and her children who were in the room on the other side, she told us that the same had happened the night before, so she had two nights of disturbed sleep, we agreed we would not stay at the Raglan again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear.....”
Reviews.Author: jera1905
Reviews.Content: I phoned the hotel to ask what time I could book in and was told 3pm...when I looked at some small print in an email they had sent previously I found it was actually 2pm - staff being less than accurate fro the word go was not a good impression. I was in room 202 and was getting on with some work in preparation for the next day when the next door neighbour decided to start playing an electric guitar!!! This was from the property next door but the noise was awful. I was moved to room 224 which I was assured was quiet (there was a bit of a hum from the aircon fans which must have been on the roof above but it was just about tolerable). All was going ok until about 5.30 am when I was woken by the crashing of trolleys from some delivery to the hotel. Oh - and the food??? There is a pre-dial for the restaurant and bar on the room phone. The restaurant didn't even ring and gave a tone like the phone had been left off the hook. The bar rang but was never answered so in the end I went through reception. Not impressed. Well a lasagne cost £9.00. It was clearly a microwave job (the cheese was pale and obviously hadn't been anywhere near an oven/grill and IT WAS LUKE WARM!!! I sent it back and they heated so that it was actually edible. The continental breakfast was basic to say the least. I had a picture of something like a croissant but oh no - weetabix (no sugar available) a bowl of melon (which was bland and had a hard, woody texture) and toast. not worth the extra frankly. The room had cobwebs on the light and the shower curtain had 6 inches of gap at the bottom so the water went everywhere. I stayed at the hotel through necessity and frankly I would only ever go back there as a last resort or if location was more important than service or value for money. Raglan - your manager will be getting an email very soon!!! Awful!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: sweet4
Reviews.Content: Myself and my hubby stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights,and would not go back,we booked a double room,which was small,and as others say it is hot, there is no air conditioning. We were the only people at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie511
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews on this hotel, I was a little nervous at what it would be like - I shouldn't have worried! We stayed for 3 nights in a very clean modern room (maybe a little scuffed here and there) and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The staff were lovely, great breakfast and waitress and at an extremely good price! The hotel is one minute from bars and restaurants, with an excellent bus service to the tube. Maybe those who had found the staff unhelpful in the past, had been to a different hotel, or were perhaps rude themselves, as nothing seemed too much trouble for those we met! .N.B. If you are booking through an agent, please be aware that the booking is initially made in the agents name - not yours. This can lead to a little confusion if you ring to check on your booking, but is easily resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, with poor reception staff”
Reviews.Author: graynz
Reviews.Content: Location ideal for a nearby funeral we needed to stayed overnight to attend. Reception staff had very poor and casual attitude - definitely could do with customer service training. Small basic room with small double bed on ground floor with window facing narrow service area. Reception carpet needed a good clean. The website makes the hotel look better than it is. Good points - bedding clean & recption bathrooms well presented. Anita & Maurice Gray (NZ)

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: MerseysidePinkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Room 211 - shower screen had no rubber on the bottom and so every time you used it, the bathroom floor got soaked. Sink also leaked, leaving big puddle on floor. Toilet was disgusting, brown, ground in stains at the bottom, in need of a bottle of bleach down it. Mattress felt really old and worn. No air con. Way too noisy outside to leave window open for air. Very rowdy bar in hotel. Do yourself a favour and look for something else. Room service next day only changed towels and made beds, no tea bags or milk left, dishes not taken from room and cups not washed. Just not good enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get a discount”
Reviews.Author: Bellie710
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel with a really good discount so the room only cost £57 including breakfast. I wouldn't have been that impressed if we had paid the full price as the room was very small and quite basic only a bed a desk and a small wardrobe but it was clean

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had checked this site first avoid at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: shahug
Reviews.Content: I normally always check trip advisors website before booking any hotel I didnt this time and boy am I sorry I had booked this hotel by the website was very impressed with how they sold their hotel was expecting big things and god was I upset when we got to our room!! when we walked into the lobby was happy enough everything was modern and stylish when I was asked to pay on arrival I was quite suprised (not so much now as you would probably leave straight away) then when they said there was no lift I was horrified you walk behind the reception to get to the staircase where only one person can fit at a time old creaky steps we had four flights to go to get to the second floor where our room was when we walked in I nearly died it was TINY two steps from the door was the bed and there wasn't even room for one person to walk around the bed and the heat would have knocked you down when you walked into the room ( had to pretty much keep the window open all weekend) the bathroom was literally when you sat on the toilet you could wash your hands and the shower was the other side of sink and was tiny you could bearly fit in it...I know london hotels the rooms can be small but this was ridiculous for the price you pay £285 for 3 night room only and then they have the cheek to ask you for £8.50 for breakfast!! would never go back here again and the bull that they put on their website NOT IMPRESSED thankfully we did that much sightseeing we virtually only slept in the room but the first night we got there they had some kind of party on where they opened the bar from 2.30am to 5am and the guests were pretty noisy and as we had to sleep with window opened didnt get any sleep!! I would never recommend this hotel Muswell Hill Hotel down the hill much better friend of ours stayed in it room was average size included breakfast and it was only £60 a night that is were we will be staying if we return as at least Muswell Hill Hotel doesnt sell itself to be anything other than what it is shame on you Raglan Hall.....

Reviews.Title: “Extremely enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: WelshGirlSwansea
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Raglan Hall hotel in November, we went to a gig at the relatively nearby Alexandra Palace. I booked with booking.com, and the hotel rang me 2 days before we were due to arrive to confirm our booking was correct. We arrived at the hotel at 2.45 - check-in is at 3, but our room was ready, we were just asked to hang on for 5 mins whilst they put the champagne and chocolates I'd ordered in the room for us. Lovely, spacious room, luxurious 4 poster bed (as requested), TV, hairdryer, balcony (no door, just windows to climb out of, but never mind), small bathroom but great power shower. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and got us a taxi to the concert venue within minutes of requesting one. There was a wedding party at the hotel in the evening, which was in full swing when we got back, but we didn't find it noisy (which was excellent considering we were on the first floor). Only downside is the offsite parking. We were warned that they had no parking, but there was one round the corner (behind Marks and Spencer), we were given clear directions to it, and it's only a 2minute walk from the hotel. It was free overnight, and we only had to pay a couple of quid to leave the car there the following day while we went into the city centre. Nearest tube station is 20minutes' walk away (or 5 in a taxi), but it was dry, and quite an enjoyable walk as it's a nice area, and it's then roughly 30mins on the Tube to the City Centre, but I chose the hotel for its closeness to Alexandra Palace. If you're going to be spending the majority of your time in the City Centre, Muswell Hill is not a place to stay as - even though it's lovely and relatively quiet - it's a fair distance. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Gemma101Bristol
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand what the previous bad reviews are going on about! We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of January and thought it was superb right from the moment we checked in. Our room was lovely and clean as was the bathroom. We found all the staff very helpful indeed and the breakfast was very good with lots of choice and the portions were excellent. All iln all a very good stay and would definitely go there again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: duke99hull
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Raglan the week before christmas and the hotel was excellent. We had a room on the top floor of the hotel, which was modern, spacious, clean and tidy. The bathroom was lovely and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent, very good choice with excellent portions. The quality of the food was also very good. We used the hotel mainly as a base as the purpose of our visit was to spend time in London. I would certainly stay at the hotel again. The staff are all very friendly and Muswell Hill is trendy with some nice Restaurants and coffee shops to visit. The hotel does not have parking, however it only took me 5 minutes to find a space near the hotel on the street and it was free of charge for the duration of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “DREADFUL - Makes Fawlty Towers look like a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: bolli39
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we chose to stay here on our wedding night as we were going to the Rufus Wainwright concert at Kenwood. It was truly awful. From our arrival when the reception staff denied any knowledge of our online booking despite us having a printed confirmation with us which we presented them with. They were extremely rude and very very unhelpful. After about an hour they finally found us a poky little room but not the 4 poster we had booked (and already paid for - more later). The terrace was 'unavailable' we later discovered this was because a party was booked for that evening. Friends were joining us to celebrate our marriage that morning with a glass of champagne - guess what? No champagne - they finally managed to rustle some up about 20 minutes later. Throughout all of this the reception staff particulary the head receptionist made us feel as if they were doing us a favour. I do not think any of them are familiar with the concept of service and that when dealing with customers you operate on the basis that you the hotel may be at fault until you sort it out. They argued and argued that we had not already paid even though I knew I had seen it on our credit card statement and were vehement in their insistence that it was a pre-authorisation. Finally we were in the poky little room after hauling bags up a cramped shabby staircase and corridor relieved to be away from the AWFUL receptionist when she knocked on the door. I was so upset by this point I told them to go away the knocking persisted and I finally went to the door. Faced yet again with the awful receptionist and an events manager who said the general manager was unavailable but would speak to us both the following morning and that our room for the evening would be complimentary but not the champagne and flowers we had ordered for our room. We were staying in a family room the following night with our children to spend time with our friends in London. We went out for the evening and thankfully had a great time at the concert but stayed out as late as we could to avoid going back to the hotel. We met the manager the following morning who was superficially sympathetic and quite charming but refused my request for the receptionist to sit in on the chat with us as I wanted to speak to her about her behaviour the previous day. We did not have to pay for the room on our wedding night but did for the family room on the Sunday. He invited us to return to the hotel as complimentary guests for the weekend I feel however this was merely to ensure we paid for the room on the Sunday evening and was not a sincere offer. The housekeeper at the hotel was lovely and the only genuine member of staff we had any dealings with. When we arrived home I checked our credit card statement and we had indeed already paid for the room. We raised this with the manager Thomas on the phone - again we were told it was a pre-authorisation and our card had not been debited. He then refused to respond to further e-mails and said he would do nothing unless he could see our credit statement. There was no offer to check his own records or look into it at their end he insisted he would do nothing without our credit card statment. After the treatment and behaviour we had already received at their hands we were unwilling to do this. We had to raise a dispute with our credit card company and received a refund from them. Needless to say we have not pursued his disingenuous offer of a complimentary stay.

Reviews.Title: “An utterly terrible and miserable stay”
Reviews.Author: Chandlerbing-UK
Reviews.Content: Firstly I was unable to park at the hotel, I arrived at 11.15pm on a Sunday night, so my own fault I guess, but there was 1 space, that had a sign - "Park here and you will be clamped!" When asked could I use it, was told it was reserved although no-one ended up using it at all. So I had to park 1/4 mile away and walk back. I stayed here a few years ago and the public areas have been greatly improved and the rooms refurbished to a fairly high standard and they did have wifi. But that's the good news over with I'm afraid. Upon reflection I may have been duped by the website, be aware its nothing like it in real life! I was put in a tiny room next to the staircase that squeaked every time someone went up or down the stairs. There were no Tea of Coffee facilities. There was a seperate toilet and bathroom both of which were unbelievably small, all in all it seemed ridiculous for £100 a night. Oh and finally, the duvet cover seemed to have an undersized duvet in it that wouldn't cover my feet (I'm only 5ft 11in) - surely this isn't too much to expect! Breakfast was a nightmare. No cereal was on offer with the cooked breakfast. Halfway through ordering my food, the waiter interrupted and asked if I wanted Juice then walked off. He returned 3 mins later with the Juice and the breakfast (that I hadn't finished ordering), when I told him I hadn't ordered yet, he huffed off again and moaned about me to the chef. 15 mins later my original breakfast, (looking rather overcooked now) returned with eggs as I wanted them. That being said when I put my knife in the poached egg the uncooked runny egg white ran all over my plate. As time was now against me, I had to leave most of it. In short I feel that I have given this place a second chance, there won't be a third.

Reviews.Title: “Reviewers are being particularly hard”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyJoWendy
Reviews.Content: Some of the recent reviews have been unnecessarily hard on this hotel. It is not bad for a 3 star in the outskirts of London. Admittedly it has a few problems - like no parking, very narrow stairs, small rooms and shower rooms (no bath) but this is London! The staff were always pleasant and helpful, and breakfast was very reasonably priced and food plentiful and freshly cooked. We did miss a tea/coffee maker but the coffee at breakfast was very good. Requests for more hangers and an iron/ironing board were promptly and willingly fulfilled and, because of the stairs, we were asked if we needed help with our bags. Our room was sparse but very clean, smart and comfortable. To stay for 3 or 4 nights would not be a problem (we did). Double Decker bus service into the city tourist spots was fun and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: skippy27
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel because it is within walking distance from friends who live in north London. However, there was total disorganisation from the start. Initially, I booked via the hotel website - four-poster with B&B for 2. I got a phone call the following day to say the hotel had been refurbished and although they could not give us the four-poster, they could offer the Executive room for the same price. I accepted. About a month before we were due to go, I thought I would just check that the booking was definitely made. Thank goodness I did because they had no record of it. I made a new booking and gave my credit card details - and here is the big problem. Just before our stay, my credit card statement showed that they had taken £99 on the day of booking. When we booked in, they told me that this was being held by the credit card company as security, and had not been taken by the hotel. On checking out, I then had to pay the full amount. In addition, there is a general air of chaos. The staff look demoralised and are generally unfriendly. Our room was hot and stuffy (even on a relatively cool night), without any window that opened more than 3 inches. Bathroom cramped. Tiny, awkward staircase from the lobby, and no lift. I would never stay here again, or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An englishperson needs tea!”
Reviews.Author: thefleapalace
Reviews.Content: I left my home comforts of at least being able to have a cup of tea to stay in a doss house. The room resembled something I would expect from a night shelter. There were no tea making facilities nor were we able to easily obtain a cuppa. The tea in the morning resembled very weak wee wee and when I asked for a tea bag I was greeted with a scowl. Although I did not pay for this hotel, as it was booked by an organisation for 16 of us, I would never in a million years recommend it even as somewhere to rest your head for the night. The bedsprings were poking up through the mattress and the bottom of the divans were bare and resembled old very stained tic pillows. The staff were not particularily helpful and this added to the aggravation. Having backpacked throughout Europe I am used to slumming it but did not expect to slum it in a £185 a night hotel. Two of the most miserable nights I have ever had! DON'T STAY THERE - IT IS TRULY AWFUL! Bare wires in the bathroom and it was so small you had to be a size 6 to comfortably get into it. Toilet paper appeared to be rationed - at least I did not have a gippy tum - not sure what I would have done then!

Reviews.Title: “Stalag Muswell Hill”
Reviews.Author: Euroscrote
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel but she and I, like other reviewers, were taken in by the Best Western label. We had a superb wedding reception at the Best Western Royal Victoria, in St Leonards, for example. The website should have been a warning, being full of rules and regulations but when you got to the place you were confronted by even more notices telling you what you could and could not do. It was more like a prison than a hotel. The room was small and cramped with a strong smell of drains from the bathroom. In this bathroom there was no room to put anything and towels were out of reach to any but rather tall people. There was very limited drawer or hanging space in the room itself and the bed was narrow. We went out for the evening and each timeyou come in you have to report to reception and get your key reactivated. Breakfast was also an interesting experience with the dining room having a faintly Orwellian atmosphere or, for those who remember it, putting me in mind of the establishments for "commercial travellers" in Dennis Potter's Pennies from Heaven. The actual breakfast was extra but not unreasonably priced. It was fairly generous served plated rather than a buffet although not of great quality. The promised preserves never materialised and the plate was swimming in rather rancid oil. All in all, I don't think this establishment is going to pick up too many people displaced from the Savoy.

Reviews.Title: “Raglan rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: Tgra5
Reviews.Content: We had a specific requirement for our stay, as we needed a baby cot for our 1 year old toddler. I made at least a dozen phone calls to the hotel before our stay to confirm the cot and make sure we had a room with enough space for us and the baby. Because I booked through Ebookers, the hotel had no record of me until the day before our reservation. The room we were given was claustrophobic for a single person and impossible for three. The cot was squashed up against the bed, which had less than a foot of space around it in any case. There was only one overhead light and no lamps or bed lights so once the baby went to sleep we were banging around in the dark trying to find our pyjamas. There was no space in the room for our luggage, which had to be stored 3 flights down in a room off the lobby. I never did find my toothbrush. The bathroom was equally small, and the shower was so tiny that it was impossible to raise your arms inside. The room was clean and the staff were fine but we wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. There were some deluxe rooms that probably had more space (judging by the hotel website) but most of the rooms were this inhumane size.

Reviews.Title: “Polished website and Reception area - totally deceptive.”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie1975
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here for one night with 3 other couples. We all paid £95 and all received totally differnt standards of room. One was a 4 poster, one was average and acceptable (ours) one was below average for sure and the other, totally awful with a tiny weeny bathroom, not enough room to move around the bed or the room (as a couple). We had to make a fuss on arrival as they had booked us instead of 2 doubles, a twin and a double. despite writing on our booking form that we had been down graded from a 4 poster to a double due to non availability. To make the twin room a double, they had the ingenious idea of shoving the single beds together and rearranging the bedding. Which of course was perfect. Ahem. They tried to charge us 10% service on a round of drinks from the bar. However we couldn't even stand up at it to order our own drinks to avoid a service charge as it had the shutters down! Would stay here again if they dropped their prices, and made sure they accurately described the rooms and maybe toned down the website to something less ambitious for their actual status.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive reception for a shabby hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maltababy
Reviews.Content: The website is very impressive, thought we'd stumbled across a 'real gem'. First negative aspect was the email confirming my booking (about 2 weeks before we visited) informed me that the cancellation policy was like no other hotel I'd booked before, in that you could only cancel up to a month before your visit!! Booked the hotel as we were going to a concert at Ally Pally. Arrived to a highly polished marble reception area and booked in. Ordered a couple of Sunday morning papers and made our way up to our room. The door off the reception looked 'shabby', we opened it and climbed up a 'shabby' badly fitted brown carpet. My heart started to sink. Got to our freezing cold room. What a strange room, looked like was half way through a refurb and the money ran out. The double bed was tiny in length (my 6ft 4' husbands legs hung out the end all night!) and there was no valence covering the bottom part of it, which took my eyes down to the carpet, yuk! The carpet and the curtains were just hideous...reminded me of a dreadful flat I lived in about 20 years ago that was furnished by the landlord. The bath room had a disgusting pink shower curtain hanging around the bath which matched the equally awful dated tiles on the walls (including the cracked ones), When we left the concert we decided to go back to the hotel for a few drinks, the main bar was closed and we were directed to the empty sushi restaurant (part of the hotel) and had a beer each, as they don't sell shorts in here. Another couple came into the bar about 5 mins after us (by this time it was 11.15 on a Sat night) they were told that the bar was now shut!! As we went up to our room another chap was clearly annoyed and complaining about both the hotel bars being shut (by then about 11.30). Breakfast was OK, but not what you expect these days from a decent hotel, there was no buffet spread/croissants or fruit etc. Instead you had to choose from a choice of three options..healthy (cereals etc) cooked or something else. I always get excited about the breakfasts when I'm stopping in a hotel, but this restricted menu wasn't really anything to get excited about. No sign of our papers either. Not overly impressed and wouldn't stop here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hated The Raglan”
Reviews.Author: toulousain
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel unless you wish to be terribly disappointed.They are not a Best Western in fact 'spaghetti western' is a better description.Their website is a total fabrication, there is no bar or proper restaurant.The rooms have not been refurbished as stated, our carpet was filthy and patched, and the wash basin blocked.The staff are badly trained & some unable to understand English over the telephone. A very sad experience I do not wish to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay”
Reviews.Author: aloe78
Reviews.Content: Oh, well. I was there at the same time as the weddingparty. WE booked it beacuse of the nice web site and eventhough I read bad reviews I though I would ask for the refurbished room and we will be ok. WEll refurbished means, that they painted one wall brown color and pur brown pillows on the bed ( terribly small as well). IT was dirty! The front desk was so, so. They had to feel badly for the guests as well I think. We cancled our last night and after viewing of all hotels in the neighberhood we stayed next doors and Roseview, which was at least clean and actualy had nice feel to it. IT is as well being refurbished.DO not give them business, please.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly ruined a great wedding day FILTH”
Reviews.Author: reptile_mat
Reviews.Content: I will not be able to fit the amount of complaints i have in this space but the main point i want to make is DO NOT BOOK A WEDDING HERE. On first impression this looks nice but WAIT all is not what it seems Luckily our general high spirits managed to make the most of the occasion. The rooms were small and i mean small I could just about clean my thumbs in the sink. The hangers in the hanging spot (not wardrobe) were sticky and unclean. Nearly all of the supposed features of the hotel on their website, like the bar til 3a.m, 50inch screen. Were blatant lies. They are just not there. We were chucked out to the lobby at 11.30pm Being told that the agreement we had with the management was verbal and not valid, even after the wedding had been booked for almost a year and checking a week before everything was in order. They have had some recent problems with management leaving. This does not surprise me but is no excuse. Its simply not good enough. Do not use unless you are willing to pay over the odds, want for nothing and are not bothered by small unclean spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Not a best Western or best anything”
Reviews.Author: rod_collins
Reviews.Content: Poor access to advertised facilites due to private functions which is a regular occurence. Lounge bar closed but not advised at booking or subsequently. Noisy from private function at the front of the hotel until 3:00am. Management not even willing to talk to guests directly to resolve minor problems. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone due to poor management attitude,

Reviews.Title: “Little treasure in North London”
Reviews.Author: kayeDunstable
Reviews.Content: I had and exhibition I needed to attend in north London, hence the reason why I booked this hotel. I usually do not stay in small hotels and was a bit hesitant at staying in one. I can say that I was so surprised at how everything about my stay went perfect. The check in staff were friendly and informative, The evening meal was delicious, the bar served wonderful cocktails and my room had a comfortbale mattress and pillows with all the amenities I required. I will definately book with the Raglan next time I am in north London. Thanks for everything Raglan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined My Wedding Night.”
Reviews.Author: JK1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no longer part of the Best Western chain but is spoiling the good name of Best Western hotels. We booked a room at the Raglan Hall even though our wedding reception was at another location. We've been to Flutes Restaurant several times before and since we love the restaurant, thought that the hotel would be as good...How wrong we were! We arrived at the reception desk after midnight on the night of our wedding. The man at the desk did not seem to really know what he was doing but after about ten minutes, we finally got the key to our room. After climbing the stairs in my wedding gown and with our overnight bags, we opened the door to our room to find someone else's belongings there. They'd obviously double-booked the room. We went back down to reception, where the man at the desk told us that there were no more rooms available but they could book us into another hotel nearby. After an hour of waiting and getting more and more upset with the situation, the barman, who'd been called in to help, told us that the man at the desk had made the mistake. Our room was still available, he'd just given us the wrong key! Obviously we were not pleased with this shoddy service. Eventually we went up to our room but found that the Champagne we had pre-ordered, was not chilling in our room, so clearly the people at the front desk had just lied to us. This was not our original room and they had double-booked our room. We were extremely pissed off by this time - it was already 2 am and our wedding night had been ruined. We showered in the badly designed bathroom - the screen on the bathtub was pointless as the water splashed around the side of it, soaking the whole bathroom. We slept in the musky-smelling bed and when we checked out in the morning, we were still expected to pay the full price of £115 for room even though that didn't include breakfast and we had had such a terrible night! We have since only been offered a refund of £30, which of course we will not be accepting. Don't stay here - avoid this hotel at all costs and tell your friends to do so as well!

Reviews.Title: “Nice public facade - shame about the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: missie22
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Muswell Hill is unfortunately one of those london hotels that I hate. They update reception, make it look a boutique hotel by updating reception and put that on the website but fail to update the rest of the hotel to suit. immediately that you go through the doors from reception the decor changes to the distinctly shabby. knocked about decor, really narrow corridors. The rooms are more like a reasonable B&B than a hotel, chintzy curtains and dated bathroom fittings - nothing like the modern reception interior suggested - you feel most cheated! The hotel did however have a nice restauarant, and as a lone woman traveller, seated me discreetly in the restaurant away from the diners having fun and romantic meals which was much appreciated. The hotel was boiling hot, it was a humid night in London anyway, but london hotels don't do air conditioning well! All in all, it was a below average experience and I wouldn't rush to do it again - but if it was all that was on offer it isnt so bad that you couldn't put up with it,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at The Raglan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dannimiltonkeynes
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at The Raglan Hotel and had to put a review with you as my friend and I really had a lovely time there. I travel quite often and have stayed in most of the hotels in this area (for work mainly) but decided to spend the weekend and chose The Raglan. It has been one of the best hotels I have stayed in, in the Muswell Hill area. The restaurant food and service was amazing and was made to feel like a queen and then the bar and the bar staff made you feel at home. It was like being in London without the extorionate prices and taxis home as was able to just walk up to my room! The breakfast had a really good choice of food. I had cereal (about 10 choices) and the hot breakfast and it was too much from the portions they have given me. I would so recommend this hotel to anyone as all the staff were very friendly and accommodating. I had to ask the reception to bring me up some ammenities and within 15 minutes they were brought. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to all. Thank you The Raglan

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Raglan!”
Reviews.Author: SpecialEdition
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my husband as our friends were holding their wedding there. We had an absolutely fabulous day and the service that we received at the hotel just topped it off! I do not usually write reviews as I often stay at different hotels around the country but I felt that this hotel deserved a mention. The staff were incredibly polite, friendly and efficient. Our luggage was swiftly taken to our room as we checked in and my husband needed a shirt ironed and within 10 minutes a crisp shirt was delivered back to our room. The room was very comfortable and clean. The food that was served was excellent and from what I gather was enjoyed by all! We had a great time after the meal in the bar, where enjoyable music was played and great cocktails served, it was also nice to have a garden patio available on such a warm day. So thanks to all the staff and I will definitely return on my next trip to London!

Reviews.Title: “The Raglan Wins..even when Chelsea don't”
Reviews.Author: James_Pea
Reviews.Content: I'm not a great one for reviewing hotels but I felt the need to register and have my say purely because I disagreed so strongly with a review I saw below. Me an a couple of friends travelled down from Mid Wales to see our beloved Chelsea play on the weekend. The game very disappointing and we felt the trip had been a complete waste of time until our weekend was saved by the treatment we received on return to our hotel. We naturally hit the bar to drown our sorrows and found the staff to be incredibly pollite and helpful despite us being fair from in the high spririts. Having had our mood lightened by some drinks and banter with the bar staff we decided to try to the restaurant, a wedding appeared to be going on but we were still served quickly and the food was absolutely delicious. We will certianly be using the Raglan again next time we come down to London for a match and will be confident that we will have a fantastic time win, lose or draw.

Reviews.Title: “The little gem in Muswell Hill”
Reviews.Author: upnorth01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Raglan hall hotel for three nights and enjoyed every minute of it. From the minute we arrived the whole experience was wonderful. Very happy staff, good clean room, great restaurant and very chic bar. Parking is a bit iffy outside but big car park round the corner. So nice to have a friendly hotel close to Alexandra Palace which I go down to 4/5 times a year….. Do keep it up guys

Reviews.Title: “very impressed with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanessasuied
Reviews.Content: WELL DONE RAGLAN HALL. I stayed with the Raglan last week and I must say how pleased I was. I understand they are under new management and since I stayed there last summer the improvement is immense. They have spent a lot of money on the reception, bar and gargens and I really felt warm and comfortable there. The food is 5 star and it was nice to see the same staff there from the last time. I was given a large room facing the front and was happy to see double glazed windows and fresh sheets in a newly refurbished room. CAN YOU BELIEVE IT but I had a room with a television in the bathroom on the second night as I got a free upgrade. There is a concierge who went out and got me a bag of sweets and his help on carrying my bags and getting things for me and the ability to have room service allowed me to be non sociable. I used to write for the Newport Gazette on hotels and bars and I am giving an 8.5 out of 10 as I never give a ten and I am basing this on a three star. I will be staying at this hotel again and a word of advice-try the cocktails in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievably bad”
Reviews.Author: fancydan
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how bad this hotel is! Surly staff, filthy rooms, terrible food - trust me it just doesn't get worse than this!! Avoid this hotel like the plague.....

Reviews.Title: “Awful Awful Awful”
Reviews.Author: borissss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the WORST I have ever stayed in. The room we were in was filthy: -had what looked like bloodstains on the walls and floors; -the carpet and skirting boards were covered in stains, as was the bathroom floor, and there were lots of cobwebs in the bedroom and bathroom; - the extractor fan in the bathroom didn't work (but this was ok, as one pane of the bathroom window was smashed and the window didn't close properly anyway, so we got a lot of ventilation!); - the UHT milk in the tea/coffee basket had gone off, and was more like cheese (I have no idea how long it takes for UHT milk to go off, but I'm sure it must take a while!); - the bedding was stained; - there was no hot water in the shower; - the free movies as stated on the website didn't exist. I informed the recptionist of all of these, and suggested we should get a fairly hefty refund. She offered £10 (just more than 10%) and said she wouldn't give me anymore, as it would come out of her wages!! There was no manager in the building, and no way of contacting one for me to speak to. The cooked buffet breakfast was rather good, but only because we got there well in advance of the closing time of 10am. Our friends who got to the breakfast room at 9:45/9:50 to find no cooked breakfast left on the buffet table were told that there would be no further food cooked, and that the staff had other things to do, (although after complaining they eventually got some food.) I took solace from the fact that I wasn't the only one to have a rotten time, as there were plenty of people (mainly our friends) at reception, all complaining, when I left! I am still awaiting a phone call from the manager..... Do not go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Roseview”
Reviews.Author: Kiernan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several years ago and didn't like its shabbiness so I began staying next door at the Roseview during my regular visits to Muswell Hill. I had seen that the Raglan had been recently refubished and was impressed with the facade and so booked in for 3 nights over the telephone for my latest trip. Upon my arrival, I found that I was not expected but fortunately they had a room vacant. As I started to climb the stairs, I thought that I had been caught in a time warp as nothing 'behind the shop front' had changed. Awful decor, every floorboard creaks - very 1980's seaside B&B. The room, classed as a double was a single with a double bed shoe-horned into it, the sink was cracked and shower fitments were hanging off. I was told that the room was at the back and quiet. It was at the front, not particularly noisy but the curtain didn't fit the small window and so I was woken each morning by the sun about 90 minutes before my alarm sounded. The cheapest meal in the restaurant is about £16. Breakfast is completely self-service (no eggs this morning) and surley looking waitresses manage to wipe and set tables around you avoiding eye contact with everyone in case they may have to be pleasant. The bar is nite-club dim. No prices are displayed but beers are about £1 dearer than the place next door (rooms are £10 per night dearer). The bar staff pour spirits without using measures and you can only have doubles (50ml). In reality, you pay over the odds for a double measure but actually get whatever the barman guesses is enough. One barman thought that it was OK to put ice into a crusher with his fingers straight after handling money. In short, don't be fooled by the glass, mirrors, halogen lights and plasma TVs that you can see from the street; they are just bait dangled to entice you in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nlordship415
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel for my brother and parents. We were all pleasantly surprised by the ammentities and the clean and very well decorated room. Staff was really friendly and accoring to my family breakfast was excellent too. Would reccomend it (sorry no spa or swiming pool) to those that they expect some high standards. They have only stayed for 3 nights from 21st of May but i was visiting quite often and they have all been very friendly and nice. I even changed there for my wedding. I should have stayed there too...:) Bar is nice too but they could not do any cocteils???

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March of this year. Thought it was an excellent place. Fair sized rooms, good staff and a beauitful bar, shame the weather didn't allow us to take advantage of the back garden patio, it must be great in the summer. I searched through many London options but wanted somewhere which would be great for central London but not actually based in the middle of town. This hotel matched all my requirements. Will happily stay there again especially as the bar prices are fair, not the usual rip-off!

HotelInfo.Name: Raglan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 8-12 Queens Ave | Muswell Hill, London N10 3NR, England
